reuters.title: Tokyo's stock index falls 1,336.00 points to 24,410.56 after 87 minutes
reuters.body: Japan's Finance Minister Kiichi Miyazawa said that remarks by U.S. Treasury Secretary James Baker on Sunday that some nations were not abiding by the spirit of the Louvre Accord were just aimed at reaffirming that agreement. The agreement, to cooperate in stabilising currencies, was reached in Paris in February this year. The finance minister made the remark at a news conference which followed a morning cabinet meeting.
